objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give an overview of contemporary analytical atomic spectroscopy techniques. The course introduces the basic principles of the techniques, their practicalities and analysis options, as well as advantages and disadvantages of these techniques.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on anda ülevaade kaasaegsetest analüütilise aatomspektroskoopia meetoditest. Kursus tutvustab meetodite tööpõhimõtteid ja praktilisi aspekte ning erivõtteid, samuti nende eeliseid ja puuduseid.

learning_outcomes.en: Student who has passed the course
-- has good overview of the contemporary analytical atomic spectroscopy techniques (AAS, AES, XRF and atomic mass spectrometry), their advantages and limitations and fields of application;
learning_outcomes.et: -- omab head ülevaadet kaasaegsetest aatomspektroskoopia meetoditest (AAS, AES, XRF, aatom-massispektromeetria), nende eelistest ja piirangutest ning kasutusvaldkondadest;

learning_outcomes.en: -- has good understanding of the physical and chemical principles of operation of these techniques and the factors that influence the results;
learning_outcomes.et: -- teab nende meetodite tööpõhimõtteid ning tulemusi mõjutavaid faktoreid;

learning_outcomes.en: -- is able to assess on the basis of a description about the adequacy and quality of a given atomic spectroscopy method and about its suitability for solving the analytical problem at hand;
learning_outcomes.et: -- on võimeline aatomspektroskoopia metoodika kirjelduse põhjal hindama selle metoodika adekvaatsust ja kvaliteeti ning selle sobivust etteantud probleemi lahendamiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: -- is able to assess the adequacy and quality of atomic spectroscopy data presented by others.
learning_outcomes.et: -- on võimeline hindama teiste uurijate poolt esitatavate aatomspektroskoopia andmete adekvaatsust ja kvaliteeti.

description.et:
The final score is formed at a written examination. There will be 2 theoretical questions from the predefined list and one problem question (the exact problem question is not listed but examples of similar problem questions are given). The list will be finalized after the course and will be available via the study information system. Use of lecture materials will not be allowed, except table of atomic masses of isotopes of elements.

The evaluation is statistical: the student will receive 2 questions from a large number of possible questions plus one problem question. Every question has been assigned a weight and they will be separately evaluated using a ten-point system. For estimation of knowledge of concepts their understanding, ability of construction of conclusions and knowledge of the facts is considered. The resulting scores are summed (using the weights) and the sum is normalized to 100.

grade_preconditions.et: All students will be admitted to the exam.

grade_evaluation.et: The examination final score is formed on the basis of the examination answers. The sum of scores is converted to the mark using the classical scheme: 50-60 E; 60-70 D; 70-80 C; 80-90 B; 90-100 A. If the result falls exactly on the borderline then the higher mark is used.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
